article: This shirt has been a common piece of _ for men and women for a great many centuries. Some of the _ made from the words are as old, and as common, as the shirt _ .  "Keep your shirt on." That _ like good advice for anyone, especially on a _ day. But the expression "keep your shirt on" gives a very _ kind of advice.  It means stay _ , do not get excited. _ , it can mean slow down, do not be in such a hurry. The meaning depends on the situation. Americans began _ the expression about one hundred and fifty years ago. Back then, _ often fought with their fists over a woman, or _ owed from playing cards, or almost anything. _ the men would fight, they would almost always _ their shirts. The expression, "Keep your shirt on", was used to _ them to stay calm. It was a way of trying to stop the _ . You may say "keep your shirt on" to someone who is getting _ with you. Or, you may say it to someone who is in a terrible _ . For example, a wife might tell her husband not to _ , saying to him, "keep your shirt on", that means they have enough _ to get to the airport instead of putting on his shirt before leaving.
